alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 8:04PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Rock, Loup, southwestern Garfield, southwestern Holt, northern Custer and southeastern Blaine Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 804 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms near Victoria Springs State Recreation Area, or 12 miles north of Broken Bow, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burwell, Taylor, Sargent, Merna, Anselmo, Victoria Springs State Recreation Area, Calamus Reservoir State Recreation Area, Lillian, Milburn, Round Valley, Walworth, Virginia Smith Dam, Hannamon Bayou Campground, Kent Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Homestead Knolls Campground, Horseshoe Bend Lake, Almeria, Nunda Shoal Campground, Deverre and Divide Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 110 and 142. Highway 2 between mile markers 256 and 273. Highway 92 between mile markers 262 and 273. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
